metadata.Title: CVE-2014-2323 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
SQL injection vulnerability in mod_mysql_vhost.c in lighttpd before 1.4.35 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary SQL commands via the host name, related to request_check_hostname.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-2323` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

lighttpd - 1.4.33-1+nmu2ubuntu2.1
lighttpd-mod-cml - 1.4.33-1+nmu2ubuntu2.1
lighttpd-mod-magnet - 1.4.33-1+nmu2ubuntu2.1
lighttpd-mod-mysql-vhost - 1.4.33-1+nmu2ubuntu2.1
lighttpd-mod-trigger-b4-dl - 1.4.33-1+nmu2ubuntu2.1
lighttpd-mod-webdav - 1.4.33-1+nmu2ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lighttpd package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.33-1+nmu2ubuntu2.1').
